intro: Ceropegia laikipiensis, commonly known as the Laikipia ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to Kenya. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, trailing stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
